fr: Il traversa la pelouse. Il approchait de la grille

eng: A little breeze seemed to ripple over the grass. Something moved near him.
fr: la legere brise sembla courir sur le gazon ; quelque chose remua aupres de lui.

eng: "Stop a bit," said a Voice, and Adye stopped dead and his hand tightened on the revolver.
fr: -- Arretez-vous un peu ! dit une voix. ~~~ Adye s'arreta net, la main crispee sur le revolver.

eng: "Well?"
fr: -- Hein ?

eng: "said Adye, white and grim, and every nerve tense."
fr: "fit-il, bleme et contracte, les nerfs violemment tendus."

eng: ""Oblige me by going back to the house," said the Voice, as tense and grim as Adye's."
fr: "-- Faites-moi le plaisir de retourner a la maison ! -- dit la voix, d'un ton aussi sec et dur que celui du colonel."

eng: ""Sorry," said Adye a little hoarsely, and moistened his lips with his tongue."
fr: "-- Je regrette ! repliqua Adye, un peu enroue subitement. Et il passa la langue sur les levres."

eng: "The Voice was on his left front, he thought."
fr: "La voix etait, croyait-il, devant lui a gauche."

eng: "Suppose he were to take his luck with a shot?"
fr: "S'il essayait d'une balle!... --"

eng: ""What are you going for?" said the Voice,"
fr: "-- Ou allez-vous ? demanda la voix."

eng: ""Where I go," he said slowly, "is my own business."'
fr: "-- Ou je vais ? reprit-il lentement. ~~~ Cela, c'est mon affaire."

eng: "Adye desisted and thought."
fr: "Celui-ci renonca a tirer, il reflechit."

eng: "and there was a quick movement of the two, and a flash of sunlight from the open lip of Adye's pocket."
fr: "Les deux interlocuteurs firent un mouvement rapide ; le revolver brilla dans la poche entrebaillee du colonel."

eng: The words were still on his lips, when an arm came round his neck, his back felt a knee, and he was sprawling backward.
fr: Ces mots etaient encore sur ses levres qu'un bras lui entoura le cou ; il recut un genou dans le dos et fut entraine a la renverse.

eng: He drew clumsily and fired absurdly, and in another moment he was struck in the mouth and the revolver wrested from his grip.
fr: Il tira son arme gauchement, et fit feu a tout hasard : aussitot il recut un coup sur la bouche et le revolver lui fut arrache de la main.

eng: He made a vain clutch at a slippery limb, tried to struggle up and fell back.
fr: Vainement il s'efforca d'empoigner une jambe insaisissable et de se degager ; il tomba en arriere.

eng: "I'd kill you now if it wasn't the waste of a bullet," it said.
fr: '-- Je vous tuerais tout de suite, prononca-t-elle, si ce n'etait perdre une balle.'

eng: "Damn!" said Adye.
fr: '-- Sacre !... fit-il.'

eng: The Voice laughed.
fr: La voix eclata de rire :

eng: He saw the revolver in mid-air, six feet off, covering him.
fr: Adye vit le revolver en l'air, a six pieds devant lui, qui le visait.

eng: "Well?"
fr: << Alors ?

eng: Adye moistened his lips again.
fr: Adye se passa encore la langue sur les levres.

eng: "I ve got no quarrel with you."
fr: Ce n'est pas a vous que j'ai affaire.

eng: "That s a pity," said the Invisible Man.
fr: -- Tant pis !

eng: "Attention," said the Voice, and then fiercely, "Don t try any games. Remember I can see your face if you can t see mine. You ve got to go back to the house."
fr: -- Attention ! -- N'essayez pas de jouer avec moi. Rappelez-vous que, moi, je vois votre figure, si vous ne voyez pas la mienne. Vous allez retourner a la maison.

eng: "He won t let me in," said Adye.
fr: -- Mais il ne me laissera pas rentrer.

eng: "Get up," said the Voice.
fr: -- Levez-vous ! commanda la voix, d'un ton ferme.

eng: Adye stood up.
fr: Adye se leva.

eng: said Adye, sitting up.
fr: demanda-t-il, en se mettant sur son seant.

eng: He glanced away from the barrel of the revolver and saw the sea far off very blue and dark under the midday sun, the smooth green down, the white cliff of the Head, and the multitudinous town, and suddenly he knew that life was very sweet.
fr: Detournant ses regards, il vit au loin la mer bleue et sombre sous le soleil de midi, le gazon bien tondu a ses pieds, la blanche falaise, la ville tumultueuse ; et, tout a coup, il connut que la vie est bien douce.

eng: His eyes came back to this little metal thing hanging between heaven and earth, six yards away.
fr: Ses yeux se reporterent sur ce petit objet de metal, suspendu entre ciel et terre, a six pieds devant lui.

eng: "What am I to do?"
fr: -- Que faut-il que je fasse ?

eng: "What am _I_ to do?" asked the Invisible Man.
fr: "Que faut-il que je fasse ?"

eng: "You will get help. The only thing is for you to go back."
fr: vous n'avez qu'a vous en retourner.

eng: he said sullenly.
fr: demanda-t-il d'un ton morne.

eng: "I will try.
fr: -- J'essaierai.

eng: "If he lets me in will you promise not to rush the door?"
fr: 'S'il me laisse rentrer, promettez-vous de ne pas vous jeter sur la porte ?'

eng: Kemp had hurried upstairs after letting Adye out, and now crouching among the broken glass and peering cautiously over the edge of the study window sill, he saw Adye stand parleying with the Unseen.
fr: Kemp, apres avoir fait sortir Adye, etait remonte bien vite dans son cabinet ; rampant au milieu du verre casse, regardant avec precaution par-dessus le rebord de la fenetre, il vit le colonel en pourparlers avec l'Invisible.'

eng: "I ve got no quarrel with you," said the Voice.
fr: 'Ce n'est pas a vous que j'ai affaire.'

eng: "Why doesn t he fire?"
fr: << Pourquoi ne tire-t-il pas ?

eng: whispered Kemp to himself.
fr: >> murmura-t-il.

eng: Then the revolver moved a little and the glint of the sunlight flashed in Kemp s eyes.
fr: Juste a ce moment le revolver remua un peu ; un reflet de soleil vint frapper les yeux de Kemp.

eng: He shaded his eyes and tried to see the source of the blinding beam.
fr: De la main celui-ci se fit un abat-jour, et essaya de suivre la direction du rayon qui l'aveuglait.

eng: "Don't push a winning game too far. Give a man a chance."
fr: (No direct equivalent in text)

eng: "Promise not to rush the door," Adye was saying.
fr: '-- Promettez de ne pas vous jeter sur la porte ! -- repetait le colonel a ce moment-la.'

eng: "You go back to the house. I tell you flatly I will not promise anything."
fr: '-- Retournez a la maison. Je vous dis nettement que je ne promets rien.'

eng: "Surely!" he said, "Adye has given up the revolver."
fr: '-- Mais oui ! fit-il. Adye lui a remis son revolver.'

eng: Adye s decision seemed suddenly made.
fr: Adye parut tout a coup avoir pris une decision.

eng: He turned towards the house, walking slowly with his hands behind him.
fr: Il se dirigea vers la maison, lentement, les mains derriere le dos.

eng: Kemp watched him puzzled.
fr: Kemp le guettait, fort embarrasse.

eng: The revolver vanished, flashed again into sight, vanished again, and became evident on a closer scrutiny as a little dark object following Adye.
fr: Le revolver disparut, brilla de nouveau, disparut encore, et, a un examen plus attentif, se revela sous la forme d'un petit objet sombre qui suivait le colonel.

eng: Then things happened very quickly.
fr: Les choses se passerent tres rapidement.

eng: Adye leapt backwards, swung around, clutched at this little object, missed it, threw up his hands and fell forward on his face, leaving a little puff of blue in the air.
fr: Adye sauta en arriere, se retourna tout d'un trait, voulut saisir le petit objet, le manqua, leva les mains, tomba en avant sur le nez : au-dessus de lui flotta dans l'air un flocon de fumee bleue.

eng: Kemp did not hear the sound of the shot.
fr: Kemp n'entendit pas le bruit du coup tire.

eng: Adye writhed, raised himself on one arm, fell forward, and lay still.
fr: Le colonel se tordit, se souleva sur un bras, retomba en avant et demeura immobile.

eng: For a space Kemp remained staring at the quiet carelessness of Adye s attitude.
fr: Un instant, Kemp resta ebahi de la tranquille insouciance dont temoignait l'attitude du colonel.

eng: The afternoon was very hot and still, nothing seemed stirring in all the world save a couple of yellow butterflies chasing each other through the shrubbery between the house and the road gate.
fr: L'apres-midi etait tres chaude et tres calme ; rien ne semblait remuer dans l'univers qu'un couple de papillons jaunes se pourchassant a travers les arbustes, entre la maison et la grille.

eng: Adye lay on the lawn near the gate.
fr: Adye restait etendu sur la pelouse, pres de la grille.

eng: The blinds of all the villas down the hill-road were drawn, but in one little green summer-house was a white figure, apparently an old man asleep.
fr: Les stores de toutes les villas, au pied de la colline, etaient baisses ; mais, dans un petit pavillon vert, on voyait une tete blanche, sans doute un vieillard endormi.

eng: The game was opening well.
fr: La partie commencait bien.

eng: His eyes came back to Adye.
fr: Ses yeux se porterent sur Adye...

eng: Then came a ringing and knocking at the front door, that grew at last tumultuous,
fr: Alors, il entendit sonner et frapper a la porte d'entree. Les coups devinrent pressants.

eng: but pursuant to Kemp s instructions the servants had locked themselves into their rooms.
fr: Mais, d'apres les ordres de Kemp, les domestiques s'etaient enfermes a clef dans leurs chambres.

eng: Kemp scrutinised the surroundings of the house for a glimpse of the revolver, but it had vanished.
fr: Kemp examina tous les alentours, cherchant des yeux le revolver : plus de revolver !

eng: This was followed by a silence.
fr: Il y eut ensuite un silence.

eng: Kemp sat listening and then began peering cautiously out of the three windows, one after another. ~~~ He went to the staircase head and stood listening uneasily.
fr: Kemp s'etait assis, l'oreille tendue ; il regarda au-dehors, avec precaution, par chacune des trois fenetres ; il alla sur le carre, en haut de l'escalier ; la, il ecouta, fort inquiet.

eng: He armed himself with his bedroom poker, and went to examine the interior fastenings of the ground-floor windows again.
fr: 'Arme du tisonnier de sa chambre, il descendit examiner de nouveau la fermeture interieure des fenetres du rez-de-chaussee.

eng: Everything was safe and quiet.
fr: Tout etait en bon etat.

eng: He returned to the belvedere.
fr: Il remonta au belvedere.

eng: Adye lay motionless over the edge of the gravel just as he had fallen.
fr: Adye etait toujours etendu sans mouvement, au bord de l'allee sablee, comme il etait tombe.

eng: Coming along the road by the villas were the housemaid and two policemen.
fr: Sur la route, longeant les villas, Kemp apercut la femme de chambre et deux agents.

eng: Everything was deadly still.
fr: Partout un calme de mort.

eng: He turned the key and opened the kitchen door.
fr: Il tourna la clef et ouvrit la porte de la cuisine.

eng: Suddenly the house resounded with heavy blows and the splintering of wood.
fr: Soudain, la maison retentit de coups pesants et d'un bruit de bois volant en eclats.

eng: He hesitated and went downstairs again.
fr: Apres avoir hesite d'abord, il redescendit.

eng: There was a smash from below.
fr: un grand fracas arrivait d'en bas.

eng: He started.
fr: Tout a coup, il tressaillit :

eng: He wondered what his antagonist was doing.
fr: Kemp se demandait ce que pouvait bien faire son ennemi.

eng: The three people seemed very slow in approaching.
fr: Les trois personnes semblaient approcher tres lentement.

eng: He heard a smash and the destructive clang of the iron fastenings of the shutters.
fr: Il entendit un carreau casse, puis les volets secoues avec un bruit de ferraille.

eng: As he did so, the shutters, split and splintering, came flying inward.
fr: Au meme instant, les volets se fendirent, eclaterent, vinrent tomber a l'interieur.

eng: He stood aghast.
fr: Il demeura stupefait.

eng: The window frame, save for one crossbar, was still intact, but only little teeth of glass remained in the frame.
fr: Le chassis de la fenetre, sauf un croisillon, etait encore intact ; mais de petites dents de verre subsistaient seules le long du cadre.

eng: The shutters had been driven in with an axe, and now the axe was descending in sweeping blows upon the window frame and the iron bars defending it.
fr: Les volets avaient ete enfonces avec une hache, et maintenant cette hache s'abattait vigoureusement sur le chassis de la fenetre et les barres de fer qui la protegeaient.

eng: Then suddenly it leapt aside and vanished.
fr: Tout a coup, l'instrument fit un saut de cote et disparut.

eng: Kemp stood in the passage trying to think.
fr: Kemp, debout dans le corridor, essaya de reflechir.

eng: He saw the revolver lying on the path outside, and then the little weapon sprang into the air.
fr: Kemp vit le revolver au-dehors, par terre, dans l'allee : puis cette petite arme sauta en l'air.

eng: He dodged back.
fr: Lui, battit en retraite.

eng: The revolver cracked just too late, and a splinter from the edge of the closing door flashed over his head.
fr: Le coup partit trop tard, mais tout juste : un eclat du bord de la porte qu'il refermait sur lui vola au-dessus de sa tete.

eng: He slammed and locked the door, and as he stood outside he heard Griffin shouting and laughing.
fr: Il fit claquer la porte et donna un tour de clef ; de l'autre cote, il entendit Griffin rire et crier.

eng: Then the blows of the axe with its splitting and smashing consequences, were resumed.
fr: Puis ce fut la hache qui reprit sa besogne de destruction.

eng: In a moment the Invisible Man would be in the kitchen. This door would not keep him a moment, and then
fr: Tout a l'heure, l'homme invisible serait dans la cuisine ; la porte ne l'arreterait pas une minute ; et alors...

eng: A ringing came at the front door again.
fr: On sonna de nouveau a la porte d'entree.

eng: It would be the policemen.
fr: C'etaient peut-etre les agents.

eng: He ran into the hall, put up the chain, and drew the bolts.
fr: Il courut dans le vestibule, detacha la chaine et tira les verrous ;

eng: He made the girl speak before he dropped the chain, and the three people blundered into the house in a heap, and Kemp slammed the door again.
fr: il fit parler la bonne avant d'oter tout a fait la chaine de surete : trois personnes se precipiterent a l'interieur comme une masse. ~~~ Kemp se hata de refermer.

eng: "The Invisible Man!" said Kemp. "He has a revolver, with two shots left. He s killed Adye. Shot him anyhow.
fr: -- L'homme invisible ! s'ecria-t-il. Il a un revolver... et encore deux coups. Il a tue Adye. Il l'a blesse, au moins.

eng: Didn t you see him on the lawn?
fr: Ne l'avez-vous pas vu sur la pelouse ?

eng: He s lying there."
fr: Il est la par terre.

eng: "Who?"
fr: -- Qui cela ?

eng: said one of the policemen.
fr: demanda l'un des agents.

eng: "What s that smashing?" asked one of the policemen.
fr: '-- Qu'est-ce que c'est que ce tapage ? interrogea l'autre agent.'

eng: "He s in the kitchen or will be. He has found an axe "
fr: '-- Il est dans la cuisine... ou il y sera bientot. Il a trouve une hache...'

eng: Suddenly the house was full of the Invisible Man s resounding blows on the kitchen door.
fr: 'Soudain, la maison tout entiere retentit des coups frappes par l'homme invisible sur la porte de la cuisine.'

eng: The girl stared towards the kitchen, shuddered, and retreated into the dining-room.
fr: 'La bonne regarda fixement vers la cuisine, puis se refugia dans la salle a manger.'

eng: Kemp tried to explain in broken sentences.
fr: 'Kemp essayait de s'expliquer en phrases entrecoupees.'

eng: "Adye," said Kemp.
fr: '-- Adye !'

eng: "We came in the back way," said the girl.
fr: '-- Nous sommes venus, expliqua la bonne, par l'allee de derriere.'

eng: They heard the kitchen door give.
fr: Ils entendirent ceder la porte.

eng: There was a sharp exclamation of pain and then the axe fell to the ground.
fr: 'Il y eut un cri de douleur, et la hache tomba sur le sol.'

eng: The policeman wiped again at vacancy and hit nothing; he put his foot on the axe, and struck again.
fr: 'L'agent battit encore le vide et ne rencontra rien ; il mit le pied sur la hache et frappa encore.'

eng: Then he stood, poker clubbed, listening intent for the slightest movement.
fr: 'Puis, il se redressa, brandissant son tisonnier, tendant l'oreille, attentif au moindre mouvement.'

eng: But the second policeman, aiming behind the axe with his poker, hit something soft that snapped.
fr: 'L'autre agent, visant derriere la hache avec son tisonnier, atteignit quelque chose de mou qui ceda.'

eng: Then, as the policeman staggered with the swing of the blow he had aimed, the Invisible Man countered with the axe, the helmet crumpled like paper, and the blow sent the man spinning to the floor at the head of the kitchen stairs.
fr: 'Alors, comme l'agent chancelait, ebranle par la violence meme de son coup, la hache le frappa de front : le casque s'enfonca comme du carton, et l'homme alla rouler par terre jusqu'au seuil de la cuisine.'

eng: The Invisible Man must have started back, and he blundered into the umbrella stand.
fr: 'L'homme invisible dut se rejeter en arriere ; il alla donner dans le porte-parapluies.'

eng: "We want you," said the first policeman, making a quick step forward and wiping with his poker at the Voice.
fr: '-- Et nous, c'est a vous que nous avons affaire ! repondit le premier agent. Il fit un pas rapide en avant, fourrageant avec son tisonnier dans la direction de la voix.'

eng: The axe receded into the passage, and fell to a position about two feet from the ground.
fr: 'La hache recula dans le corridor et prit position a peu pres a deux pieds du sol.'

eng: They could hear the Invisible Man breathing.
fr: 'On entendit souffler l'homme invisible.'

eng: At the first clash the girl screamed, stood screaming for a moment by the fireplace, and then ran to open the shutters possibly with an idea of escaping by the shattered window.
fr: 'Au premier bruit, la bonne poussa un cri, se dressa hurlante aupres du foyer, puis courut ouvrir les volets -- sans doute avec l'intention de s'echapper par la fenetre.'

eng: The second policeman brought his poker down on the little weapon, as one might knock down a wasp, and sent it rattling to the floor.
fr: 'L'autre agent abattit son tisonnier sur la petite arme, comme on assomme une guepe : il l'envoya rouler par terre.'

eng: The pistol snapped its penultimate shot and ripped a valuable Sidney Cooper.
fr: 'Le revolver tira l'un de ses derniers coups et creva, au mur, un Sydney Cooper de grande valeur.'

eng: "Whup!" said one policeman, ducked, and caught the axe on his poker.
fr: '-- Ho ! fit l'un des agents. Et il plongea en avant, ayant recu un coup de hache sur son tisonnier.'

eng: He suddenly flung himself backward.
fr: 'Tout a coup, il sauta en arriere.'

eng: He handed the poker he had carried to the policeman and the dining-room one to the other.
fr: 'Il tendit a l'un des agents le tisonnier qu'il avait apporte et, a l'autre, celui de la salle a manger.'

eng: "Poker," said Kemp, and rushed to the fender.
fr: '-- Le tisonnier ! ~~~ cria Kemp en se ruant vers le garde-feu.'

eng: "Stand away, you two," he said. "I want that man Kemp."
fr: '-- Ecartez-vous tous les deux, dit celui-ci. C'est a Kemp que j'ai affaire.'

eng: "This way," said Kemp, starting into activity, and bundled the policemen into the dining-room doorway.
fr: '-- Par ici ! ~~~ cria Kemp, sortant de sa stupeur. ~~~ Et il poussa les agents sur le seuil de la salle a manger.'

eng: He heard the dining-room window open, and a quick rush of feet within.
fr: Il entendit la fenetre de la salle a manger s'ouvrir, et des pas rapides courir a travers la salle.

eng: His companion rolled over and sat up, with the blood running down between his eye and ear.
fr: Son camarade se ramassa, se mit sur son seant, avec du sang qui lui coulait entre l'oeil et l'oreille.

eng: Mr. Heelas, Mr. Kemp's nearest neighbour among the villa holders, was asleep in his summer house when the siege of Kemp's house began.
fr: M. Heelas, le voisin le plus proche de Kemp, dormait dans son pavillon, quand le siege de la maison commenca.

eng: He insisted upon walking about his garden just as if nothing was the matter, and he went to sleep in the afternoon in accordance with the custom of years.
fr: Il voulut absolument se promener dans son jardin, comme si de rien n'etait ; et dans l'apres-midi, il alla se reposer comme le font volontiers les gens de son age.

eng: CHAPTER XXVIII. THE HUNTER HUNTED
fr: * * * | En Angleterre, les fenetres sont a guillotine avec volets interieurs. XXVIII LE CHASSEUR CHASSE

eng: The second policeman's opinion of Kemp was terse and vivid.
fr: L'idee que le second agent eut de Kemp, a ce moment-la, ne fut pas moins brillante.

eng: The dining-room window was wide open, and neither housemaid nor Kemp was to be seen.
fr: La fenetre de la salle a manger etait toute grande ouverte. ~~~ Ni la femme de chambre n'etait la, ni Kemp.

eng: "Doctor Kemp's a hero," he said, as his companion looked over his shoulder.
fr: -- Le docteur Kemp est un heros ! -- reprit-il, comme son camarade arrivait pour regarder par-dessus son epaule.

eng: "Doctor Kemp " he began, and stopped short.
fr: Et il demeura court.

eng: Then he thought better of it and stepped into the dining-room.
fr: -- Docteur !... ~~~ commenca-t-il. ~~~

eng: He made as if he would pursue the Invisible Man downstairs.
fr: Puis, croyant mieux faire, il entra dans la salle a manger.

eng: It smashed a little gas bracket.
fr: Il fit mine de poursuivre l'homme invisible dans la cuisine.

eng: "Yap!" cried the first policeman, and incontinently flung his poker.
fr: Et il lanca son tisonnier qui alla briser un petit bec de gaz.

eng: Suddenly the faint pad of bare feet on the kitchen stairs could be heard.
fr: -- Hola ! cria le premier agent.

eng: He stood up.
fr: Soudain le bruit assourdi de pieds nus se fit entendre vers la cuisine.

eng: The second policeman began struggling to his feet.
fr: A la fin, il y reussit.

eng: Pause. "Doctor Kemp," cried the policeman again.
fr: >> Le second agent essayait de se remettre sur pied.

eng: "Don't know. I've hit him. He's standing somewhere in the hall. Unless he's slipped past you. Doctor Kemp sir."
fr: '-- Je n'en sais rien, mais je l'ai touche. Il est quelque part dans le vestibule, a moins qu'il n'ait file derriere vous. Docteur !... Monsieur !... Docteur !...

eng: "Where is he?" asked the man on the floor.
fr: '-- Ou est-il ? demanda le blesse.

eng: He slept through the smashing of the windows, and then woke up suddenly with a curious persuasion of something wrong.
fr: Il s'endormit malgre le bruit des fenetres brisees ; mais il se reveilla en sursaut avec la conviction curieuse qu'il se passait tout de meme quelque chose de facheux.

eng: Mr. Heelas was one of the sturdy minority who refused to believe "in all this nonsense" about an Invisible Man.
fr: Il appartenait a la courageuse majorite qui refusa de croire a << cette ridicule histoire >> d'un homme invisible.

eng: His wife, however, as he was subsequently to be reminded, did.
fr: Sa femme, cependant -- il dut a s'en souvenir un peu plus tard -- y croyait, elle.

eng: He looked across at Kemp s house, rubbed his eyes and looked again.
fr: Il regarda au-dehors, dans la direction de la maison de Kemp ; il se frotta les yeux et regarda de nouveau.

eng: Then he put his feet to the ground, and sat listening.
fr: Alors, il mit pied a terre, et s'assit, pretant l'oreille.

eng: He said he was damned, but still the strange thing was visible.
fr: Il se dit qu'il avait la berlue. Et pourtant, non, il y avait bien, la, quelque chose d'etrange :

eng: The house looked as though it had been deserted for weeks after a violent riot.
fr: la maison paraissait abandonnee, depuis des mois... a la suite de quelque emeute.

eng: Every window was broken, and every window, save those of the belvedere study, was blinded by the internal shutters.
fr: Toutes les fenetres etaient brisees, et a toutes, sauf a celles du belvedere, les volets interieurs etaient clos.

eng: "I could have sworn it was all right" he looked at his watch "twenty minutes ago."
fr: '-- Je jurerais bien que tout etait comme a l'ordinaire (il tira sa montre), il y a seulement vingt minutes...'

eng: He became aware of a measured concussion and the clash of glass, far away in the distance.
fr: Il entendit des secousses regulieres, puis un bruit de carreau casse.

eng: And then, as he sat open-mouthed, came a still more wonderful thing.
fr: Alors, comme il etait la, bouche bee, arriva une chose encore plus etonnante.

eng: The shutters of the drawing-room window were flung open violently, and the housemaid in her outdoor hat and garments, appeared struggling in a frantic manner to throw up the sash.
fr: Les volets de la salle a manger s'ouvrirent brusquement et la femme de chambre apparut, en chapeau, faisant des efforts desesperes pour soulever le chassis.

eng: Suddenly a man appeared beside her, helping her Dr. Kemp!
fr: Soudain, un homme se montra derriere elle et vint a son aide : c'etait le docteur Kemp.

eng: In another moment the window was open, and the housemaid was struggling out; she pitched forward and vanished among the shrubs.
fr: Et, tout de suite, la fenetre ouverte, la femme de chambre se glissa peniblement au-dehors ; elle se lanca en avant et disparut au milieu des arbustes.

eng: Mr. Heelas stood up, exclaiming vaguely and vehemently at all these wonderful things.
fr: M. Heelas, devant ce spectacle extraordinaire, se leva en poussant des exclamations de surprise.

eng: He saw Kemp stand on the sill, spring from the window, and reappear almost instantaneously running along a path in the shrubbery and stooping as he ran, like a man who evades observation.
fr: Il vit Kemp lui-meme se dresser sur le rebord, sauter de la et reparaitre aussitot, courant tout le long d'une allee, entre les massifs, et se baissant comme un homme qui tient a ne pas etre vu.

eng: He vanished behind a laburnum, and appeared again clambering over a fence that abutted on the open down.
fr: Il s'eclipsa derriere un cytise et reparut franchissant une haie qui donnait sur la dune.

eng: In a second he had tumbled over and was running at a tremendous pace down the slope towards Mr. Heelas.
fr: En une seconde, il avait passe par-dessus et repris sa course, a une allure folle, devalant la pente dans la direction de M. Heelas.

eng: There was a slamming of doors, a ringing of bells, and the voice of Mr. Heelas bellowing like a bull.
fr: On entendit des portes claquer, des sonnettes retentir, et M. Heelas beugler comme un veau.

eng: With Mr. Heelas to think things like that was to act, and his cook watching him from the top window was amazed to see him come pelting towards the house at a good nine miles an hour.
fr: Pour M. Heelas, penser a des choses pareilles et agir, c'etait tout un. ~~~ Sa cuisiniere, qui l'observait de la fenetre du haut, fut surprise de le voir, tres agite, qui revenait vers la maison a une bonne vitesse de neuf milles a l'heure.

eng: "Lord!" cried Mr. Heelas, struck with an idea; "it s that Invisible Man brute! It s right, after all!"
fr: -- Seigneur ! -- s'ecria celui-ci, frappe d'une idee soudaine, -- c'est cet animal d'homme invisible !... Si c'etait vrai, pourtant !

eng: "Shut the doors, shut the windows, shut everything!"
fr: -- Fermez les portes ! ~~~ fermez les fenetres ! ~~~ fermez tout !

eng: the Invisible Man is coming!"
fr: Voila l'homme invisible qui arrive !

eng: Instantly the house was full of screams and directions, and scurrying feet.
fr: Aussitot la maison s'emplit de cris, d'ordres, de pas precipites.

eng: He ran himself to shut the French windows that opened on the veranda; as he did so Kemp s head and shoulders and knee appeared over the edge of the garden fence.
fr: M. Heelas courut en personne fermer les fenetres a la francaise qui ouvraient sur la veranda. ~~~ Juste a ce moment, apparurent au-dessus de la cloture du jardin la tete, les epaules, puis le genou de Kemp.

eng: In another moment Kemp had ploughed through the asparagus, and was running across the tennis lawn to the house.
fr: Une minute apres, celui-ci, s'etant fraye un chemin a travers les asperges, accourait par le terrain vers la maison.

eng: Emerging into the hill-road, Kemp naturally took the downward direction, and so it was he came to run in his own person the very race he had watched with such a critical eye from the belvedere study only four days ago.
fr: Emergeant sur le chemin de la colline, Kemp se mit naturellement a redescendre vers la ville. Il en etait a suivre lui-meme exactement le parcours que, du haut de son belvedere, et d'un oeil si attentif, il avait vu suivre a Marvel, quatre jours auparavant.

eng: But as he passed the staircase window, he heard the side gate slam.
fr: Mais, comme il passait devant la fenetre de l'escalier, il entendit claquer la petite porte du jardin.

eng: "You can't come in," said Mr. Heelas, shutting the bolts. "I'm very sorry if he's after you, but you can't come in!"
fr: -- Vous n'entrerez pas ! -- cria M. Heelas en poussant les verrous. -- S'il est a vos trousses, j'en suis bien fache... mais vous n'entrerez pas !

eng: And Mr. Heelas staring from his window a face of horror had scarcely witnessed Kemp vanish, ere the asparagus was being trampled this way and that by feet unseen.
fr: M. Heelas, regardant de sa fenetre, l'epouvante sur le visage, avait a peine vu disparaitre Kemp que son carre d'asperges fut de nouveau pietine dans la meme direction, par des pieds que l'on ne voyait pas.

eng: Then he ran round by the side gate to the front of the house, and so into the hill-road.
fr: Il fit le tour ensuite, jusque devant la maison, puis reprit le chemin de la colline.

eng: At that Mr. Heelas fled precipitately upstairs, and the rest of the chase is beyond his purview.
fr: Alors, M. Heelas monta precipitamment au premier etage : la suite de la chasse lui echappa.

eng: Kemp appeared with a face of terror close to the glass, rapping and then shaking frantically at the French window.
fr: Kemp, avec un visage de terreur, apparut tout contre le carreau, frappa, secoua comme un fou la fenetre a la francaise.

eng: Then, seeing his efforts were useless, he ran along the veranda, vaulted the end, and went to hammer at the side door.
fr: Voyant ses efforts inutiles, il courut le long de la veranda, sauta, heurta du marteau a la porte de service.

eng: He ran it well, for a man out of training, and though his face was white and wet, his wits were cool to the last.
fr: Il courait bien, pour un homme non entraine. ~~~ Quoique son visage fut bleme et ruisselant de sueur, il conservait son sang-froid.

eng: He ran with wide strides, and wherever a patch of rough ground intervened, wherever there came a patch of raw flints, or a bit of broken glass shone dazzling, he crossed it and left the bare invisible feet that followed to take what line they would.
fr: Il courait a larges enjambees, et, chaque fois qu'il y avait un passage difficile, que le terrain se faisait inegal ou caillouteux, ou qu'un morceau de verre casse brillait sur le sol, il passait dessus, laissant l'homme invisible, qui le poursuivait nu-pieds, prendre la direction qu'il voudrait.

eng: For the first time in his life Kemp discovered that the hill-road was indescribably vast and desolate, and that the beginnings of the town far below at the hill foot were strangely remote.
fr: Pour la premiere fois de sa vie, Kemp s'apercut que ce chemin etait prodigieusement long et desert, et que les maisons du faubourg, au pied de la colline, etaient extremement eloignees.

eng: Never had there been a slower or more painful method of progression than running.
fr: Jamais il ne s'etait avise que la course fut un moyen de locomotion si lent et si penible.

eng: All the gaunt villas, sleeping in the afternoon sun, looked locked and barred;
fr: Toutes les petites villas, endormies au soleil de l'apres-midi, semblaient fermees, barricadees.

eng: no doubt they were locked and barred by his own orders.
fr: Sans doute, elles etaient fermees et barricadees d'apres ses propres ordres ;

eng: But at any rate they might have kept a lookout for an eventuality like this!
fr: mais enfin, elles auraient bien pu garder un oeil ouvert sur le dehors, en prevision d'un cas pareil !

eng: The town was rising up now, the sea had dropped out of sight behind it, and people down below were stirring.
fr: La ville se dressait devant lui maintenant ; au-dela, derriere elle, la mer avait disparu ; des gens remuaient la-bas.

eng: A tram was just arriving at the hill foot.
fr: Un tramway arrivait juste au pied de la colline.

eng: Beyond that was the police station.
fr: Plus loin, c'etait le poste de police.

eng: The people below were staring at him, one or two were running, and his breath was beginning to saw in his throat.
fr: Les gens, la-bas, regardaient obstinement de son cote ; une ou deux personnes se mirent a courir ; son haleine faisait un bruit de scie dans sa gorge.

eng: The tram was quite near now, and the "Jolly Cricketers" was noisily barring its doors.
fr: Le tramway etait tout pres maintenant, et les Joyeux Joueurs de Cricket verrouillaient leur porte avec bruit.

eng: Beyond the tram were posts and heaps of gravel the drainage works.
fr: Derriere le tramway, des poteaux et des tas de sable : -- des travaux de voirie...

eng: He had a transitory idea of jumping into the tram and slamming the doors, and then he resolved to go for the police station.
fr: Kemp, une seconde, eut l'idee de sauter dans le tramway et de s'y enfermer. Puis il resolut d'aller jusqu'au poste de police.

eng: In another moment he had passed the door of the "Jolly Cricketers," and was in the blistering fag end of the street, with human beings about him.
fr: Un moment apres, il avait passe devant la porte des Joyeux Joueurs de Cricket, il etait au bout de la rue, avec des etres humains autour de lui.

eng: The tram driver and his helper arrested by the sight of his furious haste stood staring with the tram horses unhitched.
fr: Le cocher du tramway et son aide, stupefaits de sa precipitation fievreuse, etaient la, debout, avec les chevaux deteles.

eng: Further on the astonished features of navvies appeared above the mounds of gravel.
fr: Plus loin, des terrassiers montraient aussi, au-dessus des tas de sable, leurs figures etonnees.

eng: Spurt.
fr: Serait-il rattrape ?

eng: Was that footsteps he heard behind him?
fr: Mais etaient-ce des pas qu'il entendait derriere lui ?

eng: His pace broke a little, and then he heard the swift pad of his pursuer, and leapt forward again.
fr: Kemp ralentit un peu sa course ; il entendit le pas rapide de l'ennemi et, de nouveau, bondit en avant.

eng: "The Invisible Man!"
fr: -- L'homme invisible !

eng: he cried to the navvies, with a vague indicative gesture, and by an inspiration leapt the excavation and placed a burly group between him and the chase.
fr: cria-t-il aux terrassiers avec un geste vague. ~~~ Et, par une inspiration soudaine, il franchit la tranchee et mit ainsi un groupe anime entre lui et l'autre.

eng: Then abandoning the idea of the police station he turned into a little side street, rushed by a greengrocer s cart, hesitated for the tenth of a second at the door of a sweetstuff shop, and then made for the mouth of an alley that ran back into the main Hill Street again.
fr: Alors, abandonnant l'idee du poste, il tourna dans une petite rue laterale, passa contre une charrette de legumes, hesita un dixieme de seconde a la porte d'un confiseur, puis se dirigea vers l'entree d'une ruelle qui revenait en arriere, a la grand-rue.

eng: Two or three little children were playing here, and shrieked and scattered at his apparition, and forthwith doors and windows opened and excited mothers revealed their hearts.
fr: Deux ou trois petits enfants jouaient la : a sa vue, ils pousserent des cris et se disperserent en hate ; et tout aussitot, des fenetres et des portes s'ouvrirent, des mamans emues montrerent la qualite de leur coeur.

eng: Out he shot into Hill Street again, three hundred yards from the tram-line end, and immediately he became aware of a tumultuous vociferation and running people.
fr: Kemp retomba donc dans la grand'rue, a trois cents metres de la ligne du tramway ; et la il entendit des vociferations, des gens qui couraient.

eng: He glanced up the street towards the hill.
fr: Il jeta un regard vers le haut de la rue, du cote de la colline.

eng: Hardly a dozen yards off ran a huge navvy, cursing in fragments and slashing viciously with a spade, and hard behind him came the tram conductor with his fists clenched.
fr: A vingt-cinq pas a peine, un enorme terrassier courait, jetant des jurons entrecoupes, frappant a tort et a travers avec une beche. ~~~ Sur ses talons venait le conducteur du tramway, les poings serres.

eng: Up the street others followed these two, striking and shouting.
fr: D'autres suivaient, poussant des cris, distribuant des coups.

eng: Down towards the town, men and women were running, and he noticed clearly one man coming out of a shop-door with a stick in his hand.
fr: Dans le bas de la rue, dans la direction de la ville, des hommes et des femmes couraient aussi. ~~~ Kemp remarqua nettement un ouvrier qui sortait d'une boutique, un baton a la main.

eng: "Spread out!
fr: -- Au large !

eng: Spread out!"
fr: au large !

eng: cried some one.
fr: >> cria quelqu'un.

eng: Kemp suddenly grasped the altered condition of the chase.
fr: Kemp, alors, comprit que la chasse avait change.

eng: He stopped, and looked round, panting.
fr: Il s'arreta, il regarda autour de lui, haletant.

eng: "He s close here!"
fr: -- Il est tout pres d'ici !

eng: He was hit hard under the ear, and went reeling, trying to face round towards his unseen antagonist.
fr: Il recut un violent coup au-dessus de l'oreille, et chancela en faisant effort pour se retourner vers l'adversaire qu'il n'avait pas vu.

eng: "he cried. "Form a line across ""
fr: 'cria-t-il. Barrez la rue !...'

eng: He just managed to keep his feet, and he struck a vain counter in the air.
fr: Il parvint tout juste a reprendre son equilibre ; il riposta, mais dans le vide.

eng: Then he was hit again under the jaw, and sprawled headlong on the ground.
fr: Puis, il fut atteint de nouveau sous la machoire et s'etala tout de son long.

eng: In another moment a knee compressed his diaphragm, and a couple of eager hands gripped his throat, but the grip of one was weaker than the other; he grasped the wrists, heard a cry of pain from his assailant, and then the spade of the navvy came whirling through the air above him, and struck something with a dull thud. ~~~ He felt a drop of moisture on his face.
fr: Une seconde apres, un genou lui ecrasait la poitrine, et deux mains furieuses lui etreignirent la gorge, mais l'une avec moins de force que l'autre. ~~~ Il saisit les poignets, il entendit l'assaillant pousser un cri de douleur ; puis, la beche du terrassier vint tournoyer en l'air au-dessus de lui et s'abattit sur quelque chose avec un bruit sourd.

eng: The grip at his throat suddenly relaxed, and with a convulsive effort, Kemp loosed himself, grasped a limp shoulder, and rolled uppermost.
fr: La main qui lui serrait la gorge se relacha tout a coup, et, d'un effort convulsif, Kemp put se degager, saisit une epaule molle et roula sur son adversaire.

eng: He gripped the unseen elbows near the ground.
fr: Il maintint contre le sol des coudes qu'il ne voyait pas.

eng: "I ve got him!"
fr: -- Je le tiens !

eng: screamed Kemp.
fr: hurla-t-il.

eng: Down went the heap of struggling men again and rolled over.
fr: 'Un groupe confus d'hommes aux prises roula par terre de nouveau.'

eng: Kemp clung to him in front like a hound to a stag, and a dozen hands gripped, clutched, and tore at the Unseen.
fr: 'Kemp lui sauta a la tete, comme les chiens font au cerf, et une douzaine de mains empoignerent et dechirerent l'ennemi dans le vide.'

eng: Then came a mighty effort, and the Invisible Man threw off a couple of his antagonists and rose to his knees.
fr: 'Apres un effort supreme, l'homme invisible se releva, chancelant.'

eng: And there was no shouting after Kemp's cry only a sound of blows and feet and heavy breathing.
fr: 'On n'entendit plus rien, d'ailleurs, apres le cri de Kemp, qu'un bruit de coups, de pietinement, et un souffle penible.'

eng: In another second there was a simultaneous rush upon the struggle, and a stranger coming into the road suddenly might have thought an exceptionally savage game of Rugby football was in progress.
fr: 'Aussitot on se precipita, tous a la fois, sur les deux lutteurs : un etranger, survenu a l'improviste, aurait pu croire qu'il se jouait la une partie exceptionnellement acharnee de football.'

eng: "Help! Help! Hold him! He's down! Hold his feet!"
fr: 'Au secours ! au secours !... Tenez-le ! Il est par terre ! Prenez-lui les pieds !'

eng: The tram conductor suddenly got the neck and shoulders and lugged him back.
fr: 'Le conducteur du tramway prit le cou et le renversa en arriere.'

eng: There was, I am afraid, some savage kicking. ~~~ Then suddenly a wild scream of "Mercy!
fr: Il y eut alors, j'en ai peur, quelques coups de pied terribles, puis, soudain, on entendit un cri desespere : << Grace !

eng: Mercy!"
fr: grace !

eng: that died down swiftly to a sound like choking.
fr: >> qui se perdit tout de suite en un rale de suffocation.

eng: "Get back, you fools!"
fr: -- Arriere ! ~~~ imbeciles !

eng: cried the muffled voice of Kemp, and there was a vigorous shoving back of stalwart forms.
fr: fit la voix assourdie de Kemp. ~~~ Il y eut une vigoureuse reculade de formes athletiques.

eng: "He s hurt, I tell you.
fr: -- Il est blesse, vous dis-je.

eng: "There was a brief struggle to clear a space,"
fr: "Il y eut un moment de lutte pour degager un petit espace."

eng: "Stand back!"
fr: "Ecartez-vous !"

eng: "and then the circle of eager faces saw the doctor kneeling, as it seemed, fifteen inches in the air, and holding invisible arms to the ground."
fr: "Puis un cercle de visages impatients vit le docteur agenouille en l'air, semblait-il, a quinze pouces au-dessus du sol, et maintenant contre terre des bras que l'on ne voyait pas."

eng: Behind him a constable gripped invisible ankles.
fr: Derriere lui, un agent serrait des chevilles egalement invisibles.

eng: "Don t you leave go of en," cried the big navvy, holding a blood-stained spade; "he s shamming."
fr: -- Ne le lachez pas ! ~~~ criait le gros terrassier, tenant toujours sa beche tachee de sang. ~~~ -- Il fait semblant.

eng: "He s not shamming," said the doctor, cautiously raising his knee; "and I ll hold him."
fr: -- Non, il ne fait pas semblant, -- dit le docteur, en soulevant avec precaution son genou ; -- je me charge de le tenir.

eng: "The mouth s all wet," he said.
fr: -- La bouche est toute mouillee !...

eng: He released one hand and seemed to be feeling at the face.
fr: Il lacha une main et parut tater la figure.

eng: His face was bruised and already going red; he spoke thickly because of a bleeding lip.
fr: Le docteur avait la figure toute meurtrie, et qui deja devenait rouge. Il parlait difficilement, gene par sa levre qui saignait.

eng: And then, "Good God!"
fr: dit-il. ~~~ Bon Dieu !

eng: He stood up abruptly and then knelt down on the ground by the side of the thing unseen.
fr: Il se redressa brusquement, puis s'agenouilla par terre, aupres du corps invisible.

eng: There was a pushing and shuffling, a sound of heavy feet as fresh people turned up to increase the pressure of the crowd.
fr: Il y eut une poussee, une bousculade, un bruit de pas lourds : une foule de nouveaux venus augmentait encore la presse.

eng: People now were coming out of the houses.
fr: Les gens sortaient des maisons.

eng: The doors of the "Jolly Cricketers" stood suddenly wide open.
fr: Les portes de l'auberge furent en un clin d'oeil toutes grandes ouvertes.

eng: Very little was said.
fr: On ne parlait presque plus.

eng: Kemp felt about, his hand seeming to pass through empty air.
fr: Kemp tatait ca et la ; sa main semblait se mouvoir dans l'air vide.

eng: "He s not breathing," he said, and then, "I can t feel his heart.
fr: -- Il ne respire plus !... ~~~ Je ne sens plus son coeur !...

eng: His side ugh!"
fr: son flanc... Diable !

eng: "Here s his feet a-showing!"
fr: Voici que le pied commence a apparaitre.

eng: Suddenly an old woman, peering under the arm of the big navvy, screamed sharply.
fr: Une vieille femme, qui regardait par-dessous le bras du gros terrassier, poussa un cri aigu :

eng: "Looky there!" she said, and thrust out a wrinkled finger.
fr: -- Voyez donc la ! Elle tendait son doigt tout ride.

eng: And looking where she pointed, everyone saw, faint and transparent as though it was made of glass, so that veins and arteries and bones and nerves could be distinguished, the outline of a hand, a hand limp and prone.
fr: En regardant a l'endroit qu'elle designait, chacun vit, legere et transparente -- comme si elle eut ete faite de verre, de sorte que veines et arteres, os et nerfs pussent etre distingues, -- une main, une main molle et tombante ;

eng: It grew clouded and opaque even as they stared.
fr: elle sembla se couvrir d'un nuage et devenir opaque sous leurs yeux.

eng: And so, slowly, beginning at his hands and feet and creeping along his limbs to the vital centres of his body, that strange change continued.
fr: Ainsi, lentement, commencant par les mains et les pieds, gagnant doucement le long des membres jusqu'aux organes vitaux, s'opera cette etrange transformation, ce retour a l'etat de substance visible.

eng: "Hullo!" cried the constable.
fr: -- Attention ! cria l'agent.

eng: It was like the slow spreading of a poison.
fr: C'etait comme la lente invasion d'un poison.

eng: First came the little white nerves, a hazy grey sketch of a limb, then the glassy bones and intricate arteries, then the flesh and skin, first a faint fogginess, and then growing rapidly dense and opaque.
fr: D'abord, les veines blanches, tracant l'esquisse vaporeuse et grisatre d'un membre ; puis les os transparents et le reseau complique des arteres ; puis, la chair et la peau, vagues, a peine distinctes, devenant rapidement solides et opaques.

eng: Presently they could see his crushed chest and his shoulders, and the dim outline of his drawn and battered features.
fr: Bientot on put voir la poitrine defoncee, les epaules et le contour incertain de la face demantibulee.

eng: When at last the crowd made way for Kemp to stand erect, there lay, naked and pitiful on the ground, the bruised and broken body of a young man about thirty.
fr: Enfin, quand la foule en s'ecartant permit a Kemp de se relever, on vit, gisant par terre, nu et lamentable, le corps meurtri et brise d'un homme de trente ans a peu pres.

eng: His hair and brow were white not grey with age, but white with the whiteness of albinism and his eyes were like garnets.
fr: Ses cheveux, ses sourcils etaient blancs -- non pas blanchis par l'age, mais blancs de la blancheur des albinos ; -- ses yeux etaient rouges comme des grenats.

eng: His hands were clenched, his eyes wide open, and his expression was one of anger and dismay.
fr: Ses mains etaient fermees, ses yeux grands ouverts, avec une expression de colere et de desespoir.

eng: ended in infinite disaster his strange and terrible career.
fr: il avait acheve, dans une catastrophe inouie, son etrange et terrible carriere.'

eng: that Griffin, the first of all men to make himself invisible, Griffin, the most gifted physicist the world has ever seen,
fr: ce Griffin, le premier homme qui se soit rendu invisible, Griffin, le physicien le mieux doue que le monde ait jamais eu :

eng: And there it was, on a shabby bed in a tawdry, ill-lighted bedroom, surrounded by a crowd of ignorant and excited people, broken and wounded, betrayed and unpitied,
fr: Et il etait la, sur un lit sordide, dans une chambre vulgaire et mal eclairee, au milieu d'une foule ignorante et bruyante, brise, blesse, trahi, sans que personne le prit en pitie,

eng: '"Cover his face!" said a man. "For Gawd s sake, cover that face!"
fr: '-- Couvrez-lui la figure ! cria quelqu'un. Pour l'amour de Dieu, qu'on lui couvre la figure !'

eng: Someone brought a sheet from the "Jolly Cricketers," and having covered him, they carried him into that house.
fr: Des Joyeux Joueurs de Cricket, on apporta un drap ; puis, l'en ayant recouvert, on l'emporta dans l'auberge...

eng: and three little children, pushing forward through the crowd, were suddenly twisted round and sent packing off again. (No direct equivalent in text)
fr: '-- Couvrez-lui la figure ! cria quelqu'un. Pour l'amour de Dieu, qu'on lui couvre la figure !'

eng: THE EPILOGUE So ends the story of the strange and evil experiments of the Invisible Man.
fr: EPILOGUE Ainsi finit l'experience, non moins bizarre que criminelle, de l'homme invisible.

eng: And if you would learn more of him you must go to a little inn near Port Stowe and talk to the landlord.
fr: Si vous voulez en savoir davantage sur son compte, il faut aller a une petite auberge, aupres de Port-Stowe, et parler au patron.

eng: The sign of the inn is an empty board save for a hat and boots, and the name is the title of this story. ~~~ The landlord is a short and corpulent little man with a nose of cylindrical proportions, wiry hair, and a sporadic rosiness of visage.
fr: Sur l'enseigne, on ne voit que des bottes et un chapeau, avec cette inscription : A l'Homme invisible Le patron est un petit homme, court et gros, avec un nez proeminent de forme cylindrique, des cheveux en baguettes de tambour, la figure rose comme du corail.

eng: Drink generously, and he will tell you generously of all the things that happened to him after that time, and of how the lawyers tried to do him out of the treasure found upon him.
fr: Buvez genereusement, et il vous racontera genereusement, lui, tout ce qui lui advint apres l'affaire, et comment les gens de loi essayerent de lui << carotter >> l'argent trouve dans ses poches.

eng: "When they found they couldn't prove whose money was which, I'm blessed," he says, "if they didn't try to make me out a blooming treasure trove! Do I _look_ like a Treasure Trove?"
fr: '-- Quand ils reconnurent qu'ils ne pouvaient pas etablir a qui etait l'argent, je veux etre pendu, repeta-t-il, s'ils n'ont pas voulu me faire passer pour un trouveur de tresor... Voyons, est-ce que j'ai l'air d'un trouveur de tresor ?'

eng: "And if you want to cut off the flow of his reminiscences abruptly, you can always do so by asking if there weren't three manuscript books in the story."
fr: 'Et, si vous eprouvez le besoin d'interrompre brusquement le cours de ses souvenirs, cela vous sera toujours facile : demandez-lui s'il n'etait pas question, dans son histoire, de trois manuscrits.'

eng: "And then he subsides into a pensive state, watches you furtively, bustles nervously with glasses, and presently leaves the bar."
fr: 'Il tombe alors en meditation, il vous observe furtivement, remue des verres avec impatience et bientot quitte le comptoir.'

eng: "But bless you! he hasn't."
fr: '~~~ Mais, bon Dieu ! il ne les a pas.'

eng: "He admits there were and proceeds to explain, with asseverations that everybody thinks _he_ has em!"
fr: 'Il reconnait qu'il en etait question, en effet ; et il explique, avec des protestations, que tout le monde croit qu'il les a.'

eng: "And then a gentleman gave me a guinea a night to tell the story at the Empire Music All just to tell em in my own words barring one."
fr: 'Puis, un monsieur me donna une guinee, certain soir, pour raconter l'histoire au cafe-concert de l'Empire...'

eng: ""The Invisible Man it was took em off to hide em when I cut and ran for Port Stowe. It's that Mr. Kemp put people on with the idea of _my_ having em.""
fr: "<< L'homme invisible les a pris, pour les cacher, au moment ou je l'ai quitte, m'enfuyant vers Port-Stowe... C'est M. Kemp qui a mis dans la tete des gens que je les avais. >>"

eng: He is a bachelor man his tastes were ever bachelor, and there are no women folk in the house.
fr: Il est garcon -- ses gouts furent toujours en faveur du celibat, -- et il n'y a pas de femme dans la maison.

eng: Outwardly he buttons it is expected of him but in his more vital privacies, in the matter of braces for example, he still turns to string.
fr: Par-dessus, son habit est boutonne, comme il convient ; mais, pour ses dessous intimes (en fait de bretelles, par exemple), il a conserve l'habitude des ficelles.

eng: "Once I get the haul of them _Lord_!" "I wouldn t do what _he_ did; I d just well!"
fr: Si jamais j'en connais le fin mot... Seigneur... Oh ! je ne voudrais pas faire ce qu'il a fait. ~~~ Je voudrais seulement... oui...

eng: He pulls at his pipe. So he lapses into a dream, the undying wonderful dream of his life.
fr: Alors, il tire une bouffee de sa pipe ; il glisse dans un reve, le reve eternel et merveilleux de sa vie...

eng: And though Kemp has fished unceasingly, no human being save the landlord knows those books are there, with the subtle secret of invisibility and a dozen other strange secrets written therein.
fr: Et, quoique le docteur Kemp ait cherche sans relache de tous cotes, aucun etre humain, en dehors de l'aubergiste, ne sait que les livres sont la, contenant le subtil secret de l'invisibilite avec une douzaine d'autres non moins etranges.

eng: And none other will know of them until he dies. H. G. WELLS'
fr: Personne n'en saura rien jusqu'a sa mort. H. G. WELLS'

eng: Presently he relaxes and leans back, and blinks through his smoke across the room at things invisible to other eyes.
fr: Bientot, il lache le livre, et se renverse en arriere. En clignant des yeux, il regarde a travers la fumee de sa pipe, a l'autre bout de la salle, des choses invisibles pour tout autre que lui.

eng: "Hex, little two up in the air, cross and a fiddle-de-dee. Lord! what a one he was for intellect!"
fr: -- Un x ; un petit 2 en l'air, une croix, puis... va te faire fiche !... Ah ! Seigneur ! quel homme c'etait pour l'intelligence !

eng: His brows are knit and his lips move painfully.
fr: Il a les sourcils fronces ; il remue les levres avec effort.

eng: The landlord sits down in an armchair, fills a long clay pipe slowly gloating over the books the while.
fr: Le patron s'assied dans un fauteuil, bourre lentement sa longue pipe de terre, sans perdre des yeux un seul instant ses volumes.

eng: The covers are weather-worn and tinged with an algal green for once they sojourned in a ditch and some of the pages have been washed blank by dirty water.
fr: Les plats sont uses par le temps et taches de teintes verdatres ; car, une fois, ils ont sejourne dans un fosse, et quelques pages ont ete brouillees par de l'eau sale.

eng: And then, being satisfied of his solitude, he unlocks the cupboard and a box in the cupboard and a drawer in that box, and produces three volumes bound in brown leather, and places them solemnly in the middle of the table.
fr: puis, une fois assure d'etre seul, il ouvre le buffet, un tiroir de ce buffet, une boite dans ce tiroir : il en extrait trois volumes relies en cuir brun, il les place avec gravite au milieu de la table.

eng: And on Sunday mornings, every Sunday morning, all the year round, while he is closed to the outer world, and every night after ten, he goes into his bar parlour, bearing a glass of gin faintly tinged with water, and having placed this down, he locks the door and examines the blinds, and even looks under the table.
fr: Le dimanche matin, tous les dimanches matin, tout le long de l'annee, tandis que l'auberge est fermee au monde, et de meme tous les soirs, apres dix heures, il va dans le salon, avec un verre de gin legerement coupe d'eau et, l'ayant pose, il ferme a clef la porte, il examine les stores, il regarde sous la table ;

eng: But he has a reputation for wisdom and for a respectable parsimony in the village, and his knowledge of the roads of the South of England would beat Cobbett.
fr: Il a dans le village une reputation de sagesse et de respectable economie. Pour sa connaissance des routes dans le sud de l'Angleterre, il rendrait des points a Cobbett lui-meme.

eng: His movements are slow, and he is a great thinker.
fr: Ses mouvements sont mesures : c'est un penseur.

eng: He conducts his house without enterprise, but with eminent decorum.
fr: Il dirige son etablissement sans esprit d'initiative, mais avec une dignite parfaite.

eng: "Full of secrets," he says. "Wonderful secrets!"
fr: -- C'est plein de secrets, ca ! dit-il, de secrets merveilleux !

eng: Then he pulls one towards him and opens it, and begins to study it turning over the leaves backwards and forwards.
fr: Puis, il en met un devant lui et commence a l'etudier, tournant et retournant les feuillets.
